reasoning: Rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder; SPG5A represents <1% of all hereditary spastic paraplegia cases. Prevalence estimated at ~0.05 per 100k based on aggregate HSP prevalence data (0.3-10 per 100k globally) with SPG5A accounting for <1% of cases. Limited to case reports and small family studies; no population-based epidemiological data available.
